alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 11:11PM CDT until April 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Nacogdoches, Smith, Rusk and Cherokee Counties. For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mud Creek Near Jacksonville. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 9.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 04/10/1942. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 1115 PM CDT.
